snippet: American troops returning for the first time since 2011 said they were stunned by the state of the army they had once trained.
abstract: Several hundred American Army troops returning to Iraq for first time since 2011, in effort to train Iraqi Army, finds that army in disrepair; Iraqi forces previously had 280,000 active-duty personnel but is now down to some 50,000 troops; in wake of corruption and desertion, forces are seen as vulnerable to Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: American troops returning for the first time since 2011 said they were stunned by the state of the army they had once trained.

headline.main: U.S. Soldiers, Back in Iraq, Find Security Forces in Disrepair
headline.print_headline: U.S. Soldiers, Back in Iraq, Find Security Forces in Disrepair
